messages.messageBody:
too funny, I'll fwd this to dd, she'll get a kick out of your sense of humor
...

ugh, @ 11:48 my computer weatherbug says it's already 103* out in the burbs
of SA ... blah ... the boys keep asking if they can get in the pool ...
SPASH ... sounds good to meeeeee, except DON'T FORGET THAT SUNSCREEN!!!

Pris
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

----- Original Message -----
From: <Cararmst@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, September 04, 2000 11:33 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] thanks Julie :)


>
> In a message dated 9/2/2000 2:01:07 PM Central Daylight Time,
> x_t_sipr@... writes:
>
> > bless her heart, my poor dd is just MISERABLE in the Dallas heat (109*
> > yesterday!!!) BLAH :P
> >
> > dh, dss and I will be present @ the *big event* and I'm SO EXCITED!!!
> > wellllll, let me rephrase that statement, my fellas won't actually be
*w/*
> > dd but Gramby WILL, I can't wait!!!
>
> Congratulations in advance! I'm in Dallas, too. I know your dd is
> sweltering. I'm sure the heat won't break before your daughter has that
> baby. I think there's a Murphy-type law that governs it. Something
> variation on the rule that it won't rain if you carry your umbrella. How
> about, if you're pregnant, the heat must stay above 100.
>
> Carron

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/2/2000 2:01:07 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Congratulations in advance!  I m in Dallas, too.  I know your dd is sweltering.  I m sure the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/2/2000 2:01:07 PM Central Daylight Time,
x_t_sipr@... writes:

> bless her heart, my poor dd is just MISERABLE in the Dallas heat (109*
> yesterday!!!) BLAH :P
>
> dh, dss and I will be present @ the *big event* and I'm SO EXCITED!!!
> wellllll, let me rephrase that statement, my fellas won't actually be *w/*
> dd but Gramby WILL, I can't wait!!!

Congratulations in advance! I'm in Dallas, too. I know your dd is
sweltering. I'm sure the heat won't break before your daughter has that
baby. I think there's a Murphy-type law that governs it. Something
variation on the rule that it won't rain if you carry your umbrella. How
about, if you're pregnant, the heat must stay above 100.

Carron
